title: Spanish for Heritage and Native Speakers II
subject: World Languages (2013-2019)

33A7665A49C64CD882C2C603EC3C8DFE.description:
Investigate occupations within the local community in which Spanish-language abilities are beneficial 
(e.g., interview a Spanish-speaking community member about his/her occupation)

BBD8F85F65354A45AF30F3E9E685820B.description: Compare ways to communicate and/or collaborate with speakers of the Spanish language

68C53CFF3F03413DB33466C7C01AC8A2.description: Discuss available Spanish literature (e.g., informational brochures, official documents, library resources)

6DF2ECA9DEEE4CCD8E6187C63D847870.description: Discuss authentic activities within the local Spanish-speaking communities (e.g., sports, games, travel, media, music)

E7C361A405684C2E8FE80173540D26BD.description: Investigate contributions from local and national Spanish-speaking leaders and organizations

289ECBA4F4C644918B33AE00FEA9DA06.description: Identify ways to use Spanish language skills in the community and beyond, using available technology as appropriate

4DA296A56DF84D30829004FF35D717B9.description: Explain the role of businesses and media in Spanish speaking communities, using available technology as appropriate

4849D80095D94D82B3371110E8E853B1.description:
Compare social conventions of other Spanish-speaking communities to the students’ community 
(e.g., meeting new people, dating, school, employment, transportation)

CB64F960B6D047D88133CFA7A5257FF0.description:
Investigate social and religious beliefs and views of Spanish-speaking communities 
(e.g., social hierarchy, religion)

F3FFE18CA9F2450FB2278864E5F0C266.description:
Investigate cultural traditions and celebrations of Spanish-speaking communities 
(e.g., visual arts, music, dance, food)

D265D65D5B6447F38392B2D7971A5C9D.description: Investigate the various effects of Anglicisms in Spanish-speaking countries

53F9EDD8457C4E23B25412225C3D7799.description: Identify the influence of indigenous languages of Spanish-speaking countries on modern Spanish

06AF4DBF55344C5E98A9691ADD2C0B29.description: Classify dialects, pitch, and intonation used in Spanish-speaking countries and the United States

5FFC6B3FAE7A4CC1BBBF7AEAE718AF51.description: Compare and contrast idioms, regionalisms, colloquialisms, and proverbs from various Spanish-speaking countries

BBFC12179032420FA14B953E8FB160A6.description:
Investigate the contribution of products to other cultures 
(e.g., piñata, chocolate, sugar cane, coffee, the arts)

5465B0B2E4104F26AD661B417C762466.description:
Analyze, in standard Spanish using authentic sources, the interdependence that exists between the Spanish-speaking cultures and the world 
(e.g., imports/exports, natural resources, medicine)

8EB8D6AB59CB4E6E9CDF8AEDB1E9D0EB.description: Compare and contrast political systems of Spanish-speaking countries to those of the United States (e.g., laws protecting citizens’ rights, naturalization)

7FABF80423024A3799F18A0175F49874.description:
Compare and contrast superstitions and legends to those of the United States  
(e.g., breaking a mirror, mal de ojo, La Llorona, Headless Horseman)

5A4BEB3453C340238CF7AF1F9AB61581.description: Investigate the spread of Spanish language and culture from the Iberian peninsula

A9A7546CDB5C4784A7A40F2CA092DF2C.description:
Investigate the influences of notable Spanish speakers 
(e.g., Fidel Castro, Jorge Ramos, Salma Hayek)

B6059B6A560A4054BFA05435EB4934F9.description: Evaluate the credibility and accuracy of authentic research sources in various disciplines

86D05E0C33424C078C4CAF59C44A6465.description: Participate in authentic games and sports

FE72F50169134B01AF466445FA926029.description:
Compare and contrast examples of artistic expression representative of Spanish-speaking communities 
(e.g., art, dance, music, film/video)

ACE3CA96575742179D43B8D12A089D73.description:
Investigate various aspects of modern Spanish-speaking communities in the United States and the world 
(e.g., dance, education, family)

6314DAEA96634BB786449689A37E0D55.description:
Investigate various aspects of pre-Columbian societies 
(e.g., social structure, architecture)

64BB329EEC2240B7817CA59D9CB45D0D.description: Discuss the facts, informed opinions, and bias in mass media, multimedia, and the Internet

A1ED7CEE87694C9DABBE243E6A85E6B6.description: Compare and contrast unique cultural perspectives reflected in products (e.g.,Virgen de Guadalupe, luchadores)

13F34FAA92B043F38015C4A09B0020EF.description: Analyze the impact of geography on daily life in Spanish-speaking communities

F28C1CF8E14C4B4A8B679C82A1ED97DB.description:
Compare and contrast the influence of contemporary events on individual and group perspectives, in standard Spanish  
(e.g., narcotráfico, political asylum)

5C48729E07C64960B051151AE5F07F0D.description:
Discuss in standard Spanish the influence of historical events and figures on individual and group perspectives 
(e.g., revolutionary movements, Emiliano Zapata, Simón Bolívar)

844CBB0545AC46D4B6A387F993CC8F5C.description:
Analyze the relationship between environments and products of Spanish-speaking cultures 
(e.g., geography, climate, natural resources, politics, society, migration)

4885CD89AC454351BB9E93C9007289E5.description:
Research historical contributions of Spanish-speaking communities to the rest of the world through literature and music 
(e.g., “A Roosevelt” by Ruben Darío, “Mi caballo mago” by Sabine Ulibarrí, salsa)

300ED40CE0194EBAA1A4EBCBE13E3F14.description:
Interpret artistic expression of the Spanish-speaking world 
(e.g., visual art, music, dance, plays)

69BC735819AC46938910298946394E4E.description: Analyze products and perspectives of indigenous groups of Spanish-speaking people found in the United States and the world

C72C2CE714554B91B63E5394642E9195.description:
Analyze unique cultural perspectives reflected in practices  
(e.g., día de los muertos, cinco de mayo, independencia)

76D59B10EB4440CA8DEC519EF5966964.description: Analyze gender roles in history, literature, and the media in Spanish-speaking communities found in the United States and the world

7AB0FEB9C5804A959A04F7CB8EB15757.description:
Compare and contrast culturally appropriate behaviors in a variety of situations 
(e.g., verbal and nonverbal greetings, gestures, customs, expressions)

15AB45E1C61C4AB0B88D05A3B3B0C09A.description:
Analyze the influence of other cultures on the language of Spanish-speaking communities 
(e.g., aguacate, almohada, ojalá, vos)

C30AF2ADE93C4623A3114F7E370EBCE9.description: Analyze social, historical, and literary traditions and viewpoints of Spanish-speaking communities found in the United States and the world

A25246A9FD854305A2733C61C7BE6231.description:
Use syntax, orthography, and pronunciation effectively according to language development level (capitalization, phonetic homonyms 
(e.g., ll/y, g/j, s/c/z), written accents)

3873AE9B942A4F92B3F7060C6F60EFF6.description:
Produce level-appropriate visual or multimedia projects with special characters using available technology 
(e.g., poster, brochure, slideshow, podcast)

F864B6111BF945758795257B649C3628.description: Write short informational/explanatory or argumentative compositions citing evidence

B6D9BADECDFC41BAA47A14A91F36FD51.description: Present authentic short literary or musical works illustrating historic events in Spanish-speaking communities in the United States and the world

CD7B48D9357C422D930723F15C11A03B.description: Sustain fluid, sequential, straight-forward presentations citing evidence and relevant examples

D9B370BA165646EABA149E6A9A367244.description: Write clear, detailed, straight-forward compositions on a variety of topics

0594CE9433E44666AA9CC40C34486430.description:
Communicate using linguistic, structural, and grammatical variations (complex sentence structure, compound sentence structure, punctuation, spelling 
(e.g., accents))

6B95E4973DA24CD78E2F71AB83A2ECCB.description: Employ circumlocution skills to exchange information about unfamiliar topics

D504416C161A4A518015544C77FAA1DA.description: Identify, conjugate, and communicate using appropriate vocabulary, tenses, and moods (commands, conditional, future, immediate future,  imperfect, perfect tenses, present indicative, preterite, progressive tenses, subjunctive)

1A00587518D14FA6A6425A0049468CF0.description: Share personal reactions and opinions about historical events using authentic literary texts

9B60BD9ABA154C5089BF9A3EB2C53618.description: Express detailed feelings, emotions, and opinions orally and in writing

75C056BF37ED4ADC9FA88FB187EA08A2.description: Use written correspondence to exchange personal viewpoints, ideas, and opinions on concrete and abstract topics

333A3D2F16BE450C9A7785CEA433AD1E.description: Initiate fluid, spontaneous conversation using appropriate register and nonverbal communication

7A8F59A7378F494DBEFE689077921692.description: Discuss a variety of topics using appropriate register

417EF709F9744CDA9951C5627DAFA78A.description:
Use intonation of syllables to recognize accentuation 
(e.g., papa vs. papá, hablo vs. habló)

7F8DF16A2B9B44EDB42463AD1C8BFCD3.description:
Use colloquialisms, regionalisms, and linguistic borrowings 
(e.g., coquí, guajolote, palta)

24A65981BA7E44F882F8AD064E20CB70.description: Interpret complex correspondence from a variety of sources

B487AE21822F4D189FE8FAF3430E4B38.description: Follow multi-step directions in familiar or unfamiliar contexts in which a problem must be solved

F9B0B82408E9445A9C78F2D6F08601A1.description:
Compare and contrast literary styles and techniques 
(e.g., classical literature, modern literature)

3A616E91D5094FD6B60F940CB2A29B1A.description: Interpret and make logical inferences about theme, characters, setting, and supporting details in adapted and authentic texts

0980E0E784214B169E4785BA76383689.description:
Interpret words and phrases as used in a short, authentic texts 
(e.g., technical, connotative, figurative)
